results.title: Making learning more meaningful
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
Learning arithmetic and money-handling by producing play money - setting up a mint, a bank and a grocery store in a primary school grade.

results.title: Making Kitchen Cabinets
results.brief_description: An instructional video aimed at people wishing to build kitchen cabinets, in a time saving manner that anticipates mistakes and allows for corrections. Access to a small workshop, equipped with a tablesaw, a router and some common hand-tools, is required as cabinet-maker Paul Levine introduces the simple step-by-step procedures that result in a professional finish.

results.title: Making it relevant
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and James Mann
results.brief_description: Looks at the need to make changes in the curriculum in order to cater for the many students now staying at schools who are perhaps not interested in further education. This program focuses on the development of teaching strategies in home economics such as self-sufficiency and self reliance through active learning. Visits to markets and restaurants foster better understanding of multicultural food customs.

results.title: Making iron
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Film Producers Guild and John Durst
results.brief_description: Describes with the aid of animated diagrams the construction and operation of the blast furnace. Explains by simple formulae the chemical reactions, showing basic principles of separating iron from ore. The process of smelting and the two-way flow of the burden and hot gases is explained firstly in part, then as a whole, to stress the continuous nature of the operation.

results.title: Making haiku
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Annette Klingman
results.brief_description: Introduces and explains the form of Haiku and scenes from nature which inspire Haiku. Emphasises the simplicity and beauty of this form of poetry and encourages students creativity in composing their own. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Making grass silage
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, Great Britain. Ministry of Agriculture and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: Shows methods used by British farmers for making grass silage. Covers the whole process, from mowing to use as fodder. Demonstrates methods of packing a silo, adding molasses, and ensuring proper temperature to mature the silage. Shows also use of a pit - an alternative device to a silo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Realist Films, Great Britain. Ministry of Agriculture and Margaret Thomson

results.title: Making glass for houses
results.brief_description: Sand, limestone, and soda ash are the raw materials of glass; this film shows how they are obtained, and how they are manufactured into glass, both in the laboratory, and in a modern industrial plant, and the many uses of glass in houses.
results.description: Sand, limestone, and soda ash are the raw materials of glass; this film shows how they are obtained, and how they are manufactured into glass, both in the laboratory, and in a modern industrial plant, and the many uses of glass in houses.

results.title: Making films that teach
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Hal Kopel
results.brief_description: Explains how scripts for teaching films are prepared and how the films are photographed and produced. Emphasises the value of thorough and careful research in the preparation of educational film strips. The importance of cooperation between education collaborator and producer is also stressed. Illustrates different types of production - historical, dialogue, and location; also special techniques - timelapse photography, animation and x-ray photography. Prepared by the staff of E.B. Films based on 25 years experience in making films that teach.
